columns.Code: A unique three-letter code that identifies each country.
columns.Name: The official name of the country.
columns.Continent: The continent on which the country is located.
columns.Region: The specific region within the continent where the country is categorized.
columns.SurfaceArea: The total area, in square kilometers, that the country occupies.
columns.IndepYear: The year when the country gained independence.
columns.Population: The total number of people living in the country.
columns.LifeExpectancy: The average number of years a person can expect to live in the country.
columns.GNP: The gross national product, which measures the economic performance of the country.
columns.GNPOld: The gross national product as previously recorded or estimated.
columns.LocalName: The name of the country in its primary language or local terminology.
columns.GovernmentForm: The type of political system or government under which the country operates.
columns.HeadOfState: The name of the individual currently serving as the head of state of the country.
columns.Capital: The city that serves as the capital of the country.
columns.Code2: A unique two-letter code that further identifies each country.

country.table_description: The country table contains comprehensive information about countries worldwide, including their identification codes, geographic details, demographic statistics, economic indicators, and government structures.

columns.CountryCode: A three-letter code that uniquely identifies a country.
columns.Language: The name of the language spoken in the country.
columns.IsOfficial: Indicates whether the language is an official language of the country.
columns.Percentage: The percentage of the population that speaks this language in the country.

countrylanguage.table_description: The countrylanguage table provides information on the languages spoken in various countries, including details on their official status and the percentage of the population that uses each language.

columns.ID: A unique identifier for each city in the table.
columns.Name: The name of the city.
columns.CountryCode: A three-letter code that represents the country to which the city belongs.
columns.District: The district or administrative division of the city.
columns.Population: The total number of residents living in the city.

city.table_description: The 'city' table contains information about various cities, including their unique identifiers, names, associated countries, administrative divisions, and population counts.
